text: Lars Jonas Nilsson (born 7 March 1963 in Hedemora, Dalarna) is a Swedish former alpine skier. He was born in Hedemora, which is located in Sweden. He competed at three Winter Olympics. He raced in the Alpine Skiing World Cup from 1983 to 1992, obtaining two victories, both in slalom. He won the gold medal in Alpine World Ski Championships of 1985, in the same discipline. ==World Cup victories== {|class="wikitable" !Date !Location !Race |- |16 December 1985|| Madonna di Campiglio||Slalom |- |6 January 1990|| Kranjska Gora||Slalom |} ==References== Category:1963 births Category:Swedish male alpine skiers Category:People from Hedemora Municipality Category:Living people Category:Olympic alpine skiers of Sweden Category:Alpine skiers at the 1984 Winter Olympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1988 Winter Olympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1992 Winter Olympics
title: Jonas Nilsson
